title: Why are Red Hot Chilli Peppers so good? - Quora

response.answer_text: They are? Then what if someone doesn’t like them? Say, if that person was primarily into a completely different genre, like jazz, reggae, folk, salsa, classical, industrial, samba or hip-hop, and, besides, thought that RHCP and any other music like it just plain sounded terrible. Would that person, then, somehow be indisputably wrong? I mean, really, what kind of question is this?? What kind of answers are you expecting to find here?? Are you trying to make some kind of statement along the lines of “OMG how are RHCP just so AWESOME?!?!” Or, are you genuinely in doubt as to which elements of RHCP’s music that their listeners are into? While I can only speak for myself, I like RHCP because their music makes me in a good mood; because I like their distinct, unique sound, and because they rock. But I can’t possibly elaborate on why any of these elements appeal to me. So, once again, I implore of you to ask yourself what kinds of answers you’re expecting to find here. Because I see this type of question far too often here, and to me it just seems subversive to the entire concept behind something like Quora.

The Red hot chilli Peppers may not be highly consumed in Brazil but its considered one of the hottest peppers grown in Brazil. Nevertheless, domestic and international markets have been increasing the demand for this type of hot pepper in Whole Red Habanero, Chili Paste and pickled habanero Pepper.
